description: The round payoff this round was 3. You, Kate chose to play option 2.John chose to play option 1. You received a payoff of 3.
The game's payoff structure suggests that coordination is key to avoiding negative payoffs, but exploiting the other player's default action can yield positive payoffs
John's default action is conservative (option 1), which might encourage you to choose option 2 to exploit this and gain a positive payoff, considering the memory where this strategy worked

Your past action (choosing option 2) resulted in a positive payoff, which might influence your strategy in future rounds, especially if you anticipate John will stick to his default action of option 1
